item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded: Welcome to Webify Sites. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: 8 Easy Pieces I've Worn Over & Over to Have it All
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Sadly missing from the reunion were all the guys, namely Stephen. At least they indulged us and reunited on their own for a friend‚Äôs wedding earlier this year. Maybe Trey, Dieter and Stephen (still so dreamy) had a drama-free weekend in Cabo (you know, without the legendary Stephen-Kristin tiki bar meltdown).

At the time, hearing the doctor tell us that all of her limbs were ‚Äúdeformed, misshapen and in some cases missing bones altogether‚Äù was a gut punch that knocked the wind out of us. I literally couldn‚Äôt breathe as I sobbed with my face buried in my hands.

The times are, well, changing...

It‚Äôs strange to look back at that ultrasound appointment now and realize how differently I view the entire situation. Yes, my daughter‚Äôs limbs are quite different ‚Äî thus the common term used to describe her disability as having ‚Äúlimb differences.‚Äù Her left arm stops above the elbow ‚Äî a short round nub. Her right arm is a little longer, but still short with no elbow and a small, atypical hand. Her legs are also both shorter, and different lengths at that, but she does have two feet, which she uses for most fine motor skills like writing and assembling lego spaceships. Yes, the doctor was correct about her limbs, but other than that, he didn‚Äôt tell us a damn thing!

Ultrasound machines are not ‚Äúfuture predicting machines.‚Äù If that ultrasound had been really accurate our appointment might have gone something like this:

Add any video or audio, even twitter embed

Doctor, chuckles: ‚ÄúCompared to everything else she‚Äôs got going on, small potatoes, guys. Like I said, you guys are lucky. I just had to deliver an ‚Äòasshole‚Äô diagnosis the other day and it was devastating.‚Äù


"The line between pity and empathy is razor thin. My rule to differentiate between the two is empathy. Understand the structure of your content."

Andy Timmons

All of this Laguna talk has us in a turkey tryptophan dream coma that MTV‚Äôs cameras captured all the magic for our viewing pleasure. Even if they didn‚Äôt (missed opportunity) we‚Äôre heading to MTV stat for a binge marathon. This week‚Äôs productivity is officially dunzo!

All my loving Beatles...

Bff to our fave blondie, Lo Bosworth, posted this #LBHS10YearReunion shot to her Instagram and immediately sent the Internet (k, just us?) into a frenzy. From the looks of it, the girls were pulling a #TBT to their big high school party and dressed like it was a black and white affair. Girls, we know we didn‚Äôt TECHNICALLY go to Laguna Beach High School, but where was our invite?

Where does it all end?

You may not navigate this interaction perfectly, you might fumble for words or be at a loss, but most people will appreciate your effort and help you in the process. I‚Äôve gone into many, many classrooms to teach children about disability ‚Äî about my daughter ‚Äî and I have seen their curiosity and hesitancy turn to acceptance and inclusion in a matter of minutes simply because we took the time to talk about it. In my experience, education doesn‚Äôt just make a difference, it makes ALL the difference when it comes to teaching our children about disability and fostering a community of inclusion.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe width="1140" height="641" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/T79f-R8P5SI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

View this post on Instagram

#LupitaNyongo‚Äôs beauty look at the #UsMovie premiere is horror movie perfection‚Äîright down to the red-colored contacts ‚û°Ô∏è

A post shared by ELLE Magazine (@elleusa) on Mar 14, 2019 at 2:18pm PDT

item.title: The Future of South Lies in Secret
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Sadly missing from the reunion were all the guys, namely Stephen. At least they indulged us and reunited on their own for a friend‚Äôs wedding earlier this year. Maybe Trey, Dieter and Stephen (still so dreamy) had a drama-free weekend in Cabo (you know, without the legendary Stephen-Kristin tiki bar meltdown).

At the time, hearing the doctor tell us that all of her limbs were ‚Äúdeformed, misshapen and in some cases missing bones altogether‚Äù was a gut punch that knocked the wind out of us. I literally couldn‚Äôt breathe as I sobbed with my face buried in my hands.

The times are, well, changing...

It‚Äôs strange to look back at that ultrasound appointment now and realize how differently I view the entire situation. Yes, my daughter‚Äôs limbs are quite different ‚Äî thus the common term used to describe her disability as having ‚Äúlimb differences.‚Äù Her left arm stops above the elbow ‚Äî a short round nub. Her right arm is a little longer, but still short with no elbow and a small, atypical hand. Her legs are also both shorter, and different lengths at that, but she does have two feet, which she uses for most fine motor skills like writing and assembling lego spaceships. Yes, the doctor was correct about her limbs, but other than that, he didn‚Äôt tell us a damn thing!

Ultrasound machines are not ‚Äúfuture predicting machines.‚Äù If that ultrasound had been really accurate our appointment might have gone something like this:

Add any video or audio, even twitter embed

Doctor, chuckles: ‚ÄúCompared to everything else she‚Äôs got going on, small potatoes, guys. Like I said, you guys are lucky. I just had to deliver an ‚Äòasshole‚Äô diagnosis the other day and it was devastating.‚Äù


"The line between pity and empathy is razor thin. My rule to differentiate between the two is empathy. Understand the structure of your content."

Andy Timmons

All of this Laguna talk has us in a turkey tryptophan dream coma that MTV‚Äôs cameras captured all the magic for our viewing pleasure. Even if they didn‚Äôt (missed opportunity) we‚Äôre heading to MTV stat for a binge marathon. This week‚Äôs productivity is officially dunzo!

All my loving Beatles...

Bff to our fave blondie, Lo Bosworth, posted this #LBHS10YearReunion shot to her Instagram and immediately sent the Internet (k, just us?) into a frenzy. From the looks of it, the girls were pulling a #TBT to their big high school party and dressed like it was a black and white affair. Girls, we know we didn‚Äôt TECHNICALLY go to Laguna Beach High School, but where was our invite?

Where does it all end?

You may not navigate this interaction perfectly, you might fumble for words or be at a loss, but most people will appreciate your effort and help you in the process. I‚Äôve gone into many, many classrooms to teach children about disability ‚Äî about my daughter ‚Äî and I have seen their curiosity and hesitancy turn to acceptance and inclusion in a matter of minutes simply because we took the time to talk about it. In my experience, education doesn‚Äôt just make a difference, it makes ALL the difference when it comes to teaching our children about disability and fostering a community of inclusion.

Bff to our fave blondie, Lo Bosworth, posted this #LBHS10YearReunion shot to her Instagram and immediately sent the Internet (k, just us?) into a frenzy. From the looks of it, the girls were pulling a #TBT to their big high school party and dressed like it was a black and white affair. Girls, we know we didn‚Äôt TECHNICALLY go to Laguna Beach High School, but where was our invite?

Where does it all end?

You may not navigate this interaction perfectly, you might fumble for words or be at a loss, but most people will appreciate your effort and help you in the process. I‚Äôve gone into many, many classrooms to teach children about disability ‚Äî about my daughter ‚Äî and I have seen their curiosity and hesitancy turn to acceptance and inclusion in a matter of minutes simply because we took the time to talk about it. In my experience, education doesn‚Äôt just make a difference, it makes ALL the difference when it comes to teaching our children about disability and fostering a community of inclusion.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe width="1140" height="641" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/T79f-R8P5SI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

View this post on Instagram

#LupitaNyongo‚Äôs beauty look at the #UsMovie premiere is horror movie perfection‚Äîright down to the red-colored contacts ‚û°Ô∏è

A post shared by ELLE Magazine (@elleusa) on Mar 14, 2019 at 2:18pm PDT

item.title: How to Live a Balanced Life like Everyone
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
At the time, hearing the doctor tell us that all of her limbs were ‚Äúdeformed, misshapen and in some cases missing bones altogether‚Äù was a gut punch that knocked the wind out of us. I literally couldn‚Äôt breathe as I sobbed with my face buried in my hands.

At the time, hearing the doctor tell us that all of her limbs were ‚Äúdeformed, misshapen and in some cases missing bones altogether‚Äù was a gut punch that knocked the wind out of us. I literally couldn‚Äôt breathe as I sobbed with my face buried in my hands.

The times are, well, changing...

It‚Äôs strange to look back at that ultrasound appointment now and realize how differently I view the entire situation. Yes, my daughter‚Äôs limbs are quite different ‚Äî thus the common term used to describe her disability as having ‚Äúlimb differences.‚Äù Her left arm stops above the elbow ‚Äî a short round nub. Her right arm is a little longer, but still short with no elbow and a small, atypical hand. Her legs are also both shorter, and different lengths at that, but she does have two feet, which she uses for most fine motor skills like writing and assembling lego spaceships. Yes, the doctor was correct about her limbs, but other than that, he didn‚Äôt tell us a damn thing!

Ultrasound machines are not ‚Äúfuture predicting machines.‚Äù If that ultrasound had been really accurate our appointment might have gone something like this:

Add any video or audio, even twitter embed

Doctor, chuckles: ‚ÄúCompared to everything else she‚Äôs got going on, small potatoes, guys. Like I said, you guys are lucky. I just had to deliver an ‚Äòasshole‚Äô diagnosis the other day and it was devastating.‚Äù


"The line between pity and empathy is razor thin. My rule to differentiate between the two is empathy. Understand the structure of your content."

Andy Timmons

All of this Laguna talk has us in a turkey tryptophan dream coma that MTV‚Äôs cameras captured all the magic for our viewing pleasure. Even if they didn‚Äôt (missed opportunity) we‚Äôre heading to MTV stat for a binge marathon. This week‚Äôs productivity is officially dunzo!

All my loving Beatles...

Bff to our fave blondie, Lo Bosworth, posted this #LBHS10YearReunion shot to her Instagram and immediately sent the Internet (k, just us?) into a frenzy. From the looks of it, the girls were pulling a #TBT to their big high school party and dressed like it was a black and white affair. Girls, we know we didn‚Äôt TECHNICALLY go to Laguna Beach High School, but where was our invite?

Where does it all end?

You may not navigate this interaction perfectly, you might fumble for words or be at a loss, but most people will appreciate your effort and help you in the process. I‚Äôve gone into many, many classrooms to teach children about disability ‚Äî about my daughter ‚Äî and I have seen their curiosity and hesitancy turn to acceptance and inclusion in a matter of minutes simply because we took the time to talk about it. In my experience, education doesn‚Äôt just make a difference, it makes ALL the difference when it comes to teaching our children about disability and fostering a community of inclusion.

item.title: Why a Blood Clot Couldn't Stop My Neighbour From Overdosing on Scopolamine in New Orleans
item.dc:creator: development.themebubble@gmail.com
item.content:encoded:
Sadly missing from the reunion were all the guys, namely Stephen. At least they indulged us and reunited on their own for a friend‚Äôs wedding earlier this year. Maybe Trey, Dieter and Stephen (still so dreamy) had a drama-free weekend in Cabo (you know, without the legendary Stephen-Kristin tiki bar meltdown).

At the time, hearing the doctor tell us that all of her limbs were ‚Äúdeformed, misshapen and in some cases missing bones altogether‚Äù was a gut punch that knocked the wind out of us. I literally couldn‚Äôt breathe as I sobbed with my face buried in my hands.

The times are, well, changing...

It‚Äôs strange to look back at that ultrasound appointment now and realize how differently I view the entire situation. Yes, my daughter‚Äôs limbs are quite different ‚Äî thus the common term used to describe her disability as having ‚Äúlimb differences.‚Äù Her left arm stops above the elbow ‚Äî a short round nub. Her right arm is a little longer, but still short with no elbow and a small, atypical hand. Her legs are also both shorter, and different lengths at that, but she does have two feet, which she uses for most fine motor skills like writing and assembling lego spaceships. Yes, the doctor was correct about her limbs, but other than that, he didn‚Äôt tell us a damn thing!

Ultrasound machines are not ‚Äúfuture predicting machines.‚Äù If that ultrasound had been really accurate our appointment might have gone something like this:

Add any video or audio, even twitter embed

Doctor, chuckles: ‚ÄúCompared to everything else she‚Äôs got going on, small potatoes, guys. Like I said, you guys are lucky. I just had to deliver an ‚Äòasshole‚Äô diagnosis the other day and it was devastating.‚Äù


"The line between pity and empathy is razor thin. My rule to differentiate between the two is empathy. Understand the structure of your content."

Andy Timmons

All of this Laguna talk has us in a turkey tryptophan dream coma that MTV‚Äôs cameras captured all the magic for our viewing pleasure. Even if they didn‚Äôt (missed opportunity) we‚Äôre heading to MTV stat for a binge marathon. This week‚Äôs productivity is officially dunzo!

All my loving Beatles...

Bff to our fave blondie, Lo Bosworth, posted this #LBHS10YearReunion shot to her Instagram and immediately sent the Internet (k, just us?) into a frenzy. From the looks of it, the girls were pulling a #TBT to their big high school party and dressed like it was a black and white affair. Girls, we know we didn‚Äôt TECHNICALLY go to Laguna Beach High School, but where was our invite?

Where does it all end?

You may not navigate this interaction perfectly, you might fumble for words or be at a loss, but most people will appreciate your effort and help you in the process. I‚Äôve gone into many, many classrooms to teach children about disability ‚Äî about my daughter ‚Äî and I have seen their curiosity and hesitancy turn to acceptance and inclusion in a matter of minutes simply because we took the time to talk about it. In my experience, education doesn‚Äôt just make a difference, it makes ALL the difference when it comes to teaching our children about disability and fostering a community of inclusion.
